intro: Phyllorkis crassipes, commonly known as the broadleaf phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with broad, flat leaflets and produces small, white to yellowish flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
